trans-unit.source: Hyperlinks navigate the user to another part of the app, to another app, or launch a specific uniform resource identifier (URI) using a separate browser app.
trans-unit.target: Hyperlinks navigate the user to another part of the app, to another app, or launch a specific uniform resource identifier (URI) using a separate browser app.

trans-unit.source: Hyperlinks
trans-unit.target: Hyperlinks

trans-unit.source: Hyperlinks
trans-unit.target: Hyperlinks

trans-unit.source: Hyperlinks navigate the user to another part of the app, to another app, or launch a specific uniform resource identifier (URI) using a separate browser app.
trans-unit.target: Hyperlinks navigate the user to another part of the app, to another app, or launch a specific uniform resource identifier (URI) using a separate browser app.

trans-unit.source: There are two ways that you can add a hyperlink to a XAML app: the **Hyperlink** text element and **HyperlinkButton** control.
trans-unit.target: There are two ways that you can add a hyperlink to a XAML app: the **Hyperlink** text element and **HyperlinkButton** control.

trans-unit.source: A hyperlink button
trans-unit.target: A hyperlink button

trans-unit.source: Important APIs
trans-unit.target: Important APIs

trans-unit.source: Hyperlink text element
trans-unit.target: Hyperlink text element

trans-unit.source: HyperlinkButton control
trans-unit.target: HyperlinkButton control

trans-unit.source: Is this the right control?
trans-unit.target: Is this the right control?

trans-unit.source: Use a hyperlink when you need text that responds when selected and navigates the user to more information about the text that was selected.
trans-unit.target: Use a hyperlink when you need text that responds when selected and navigates the user to more information about the text that was selected.

trans-unit.source: Choose the right type of hyperlink based on your needs:
trans-unit.target: Choose the right type of hyperlink based on your needs:

trans-unit.source: Use an inline **Hyperlink** text element inside of a text control.
trans-unit.target: Use an inline **Hyperlink** text element inside of a text control.

trans-unit.source: A Hyperlink element flows with other text elements and you can use it in any InlineCollection.
trans-unit.target: A Hyperlink element flows with other text elements and you can use it in any InlineCollection.

trans-unit.source: Use a text hyperlink if you want automatic text wrapping and don't necessarily need a large hit target.
trans-unit.target: Use a text hyperlink if you want automatic text wrapping and don't necessarily need a large hit target.

trans-unit.source: Hyperlink text can be small and difficult to target, especially for touch.
trans-unit.target: Hyperlink text can be small and difficult to target, especially for touch.

trans-unit.source: Use a **HyperlinkButton** for stand-alone hyperlinks.
trans-unit.target: Use a **HyperlinkButton** for stand-alone hyperlinks.

trans-unit.source: A HyperlinkButton is a specialized Button control that you can use anywhere that you would use a Button.
trans-unit.target: A HyperlinkButton is a specialized Button control that you can use anywhere that you would use a Button.

trans-unit.source: Use a **HyperlinkButton** with an [Image](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/windows.ui.xaml.controls.image.aspx) as its content to make a clickable image.
trans-unit.target: Use a **HyperlinkButton** with an [Image](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/windows.ui.xaml.controls.image.aspx) as its content to make a clickable image.

trans-unit.source: Examples
trans-unit.target: Examples

trans-unit.target: Hyperlinks in the Calculator app.

trans-unit.source: Example of a hyperlink in the Calculator app
trans-unit.target: Example of a hyperlink in the Calculator app

trans-unit.source: Create a Hyperlink text element
trans-unit.target: Create a Hyperlink text element

trans-unit.source: This example shows how to use a Hyperlink text element inside of a [TextBlock](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/windows.ui.xaml.controls.textblock.aspx).
trans-unit.target: This example shows how to use a Hyperlink text element inside of a [TextBlock](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/windows.ui.xaml.controls.textblock.aspx).

trans-unit.source: The hyperlink appears inline and flows with the surrounding text:
trans-unit.target: The hyperlink appears inline and flows with the surrounding text:

trans-unit.source: Example of a hyperlink as a text element
trans-unit.target: Example of a hyperlink as a text element

trans-unit.source: **Tip**  When you use a Hyperlink in a text control with other text elements in XAML, place the content in a [Span](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/windows.ui.xaml.documents.span.aspx) container and apply the `xml:space="preserve"` attribute to the Span to keep the white space between the Hyperlink and other elements.
trans-unit.target: **Tip**  When you use a Hyperlink in a text control with other text elements in XAML, place the content in a [Span](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/windows.ui.xaml.documents.span.aspx) container and apply the `xml:space="preserve"` attribute to the Span to keep the white space between the Hyperlink and other elements.

trans-unit.source: Create a HyperlinkButton
trans-unit.target: Create a HyperlinkButton

trans-unit.source: Here's how to use a HyperlinkButton, both with text and with an image.
trans-unit.target: Here's how to use a HyperlinkButton, both with text and with an image.

trans-unit.source: The hyperlink buttons with text content appear as marked-up text.
trans-unit.target: The hyperlink buttons with text content appear as marked-up text.

trans-unit.source: The Contoso logo image is also a clickable hyperlink:
trans-unit.target: The Contoso logo image is also a clickable hyperlink:

trans-unit.target: Example of a hyperlink as a button control

trans-unit.source: Handle navigation
trans-unit.target: Handle navigation

trans-unit.source: For both kinds of hyperlinks, you handle navigation the same way; you can set the **NavigateUri** property, or handle the **Click** event.
trans-unit.target: For both kinds of hyperlinks, you handle navigation the same way; you can set the **NavigateUri** property, or handle the **Click** event.

trans-unit.source: Navigate to a URI
trans-unit.target: Navigate to a URI

trans-unit.source: To use the hyperlink to navigate to a URI, set the NavigateUri property.
trans-unit.target: To use the hyperlink to navigate to a URI, set the NavigateUri property.

trans-unit.source: When a user clicks or taps the hyperlink, the specified URI opens in the default browser.
trans-unit.target: When a user clicks or taps the hyperlink, the specified URI opens in the default browser.

trans-unit.source: The default browser runs in a separate process from your app.
trans-unit.target: The default browser runs in a separate process from your app.

trans-unit.source: **Note**  You don't have to use http: or https: schemes.
trans-unit.target: **Note**  You don't have to use http: or https: schemes.

trans-unit.source: You can use schemes such as ms-appx:, ms-appdata:, or ms-resources:, if there's resource content at these locations that's appropriate to load in a browser.
trans-unit.target: You can use schemes such as ms-appx:, ms-appdata:, or ms-resources:, if there's resource content at these locations that's appropriate to load in a browser.

trans-unit.source: However, the file: scheme is specifically blocked.
trans-unit.target: However, the file: scheme is specifically blocked.

trans-unit.source: For more info, see [URI schemes](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/jj655406.aspx).
trans-unit.target: For more info, see [URI schemes](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/jj655406.aspx).

trans-unit.source: When a user clicks the hyperlink, the value of the NavigateUri property is passed to a system handler for URI types and schemes.
trans-unit.target: When a user clicks the hyperlink, the value of the NavigateUri property is passed to a system handler for URI types and schemes.

trans-unit.source: The system then launches the app that is registered for the scheme of the URI provided for NavigateUri.
trans-unit.target: The system then launches the app that is registered for the scheme of the URI provided for NavigateUri.

trans-unit.source: If you don't want the hyperlink to load content in a default Web browser (and don't want a browser to appear), then don't set a value for NavigateUri.
trans-unit.target: If you don't want the hyperlink to load content in a default Web browser (and don't want a browser to appear), then don't set a value for NavigateUri.

trans-unit.source: Instead, handle the Click event, and write code that does what you want.
trans-unit.target: Instead, handle the Click event, and write code that does what you want.

trans-unit.source: Handle the Click event
trans-unit.target: Handle the Click event

trans-unit.source: Use the Click event for actions other than launching a URI in a browser, such as navigation within the app.
trans-unit.target: Use the Click event for actions other than launching a URI in a browser, such as navigation within the app.

trans-unit.source: For example, if you want to load a new app page rather than opening a browser, call a [Frame.Navigate](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/windows.ui.xaml.controls.frame.navigate.aspx) method within your Click event handler to navigate to the new app page.
trans-unit.target: For example, if you want to load a new app page rather than opening a browser, call a [Frame.Navigate](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/windows.ui.xaml.controls.frame.navigate.aspx) method within your Click event handler to navigate to the new app page.

trans-unit.source: If you want an external, absolute URI to load within a [WebView](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/windows.ui.xaml.controls.webview.aspx) control that also exists in your app, call [WebView.Navigate](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/windows.ui.xaml.controls.webview.navigate.aspx) as part of your Click handler logic.
trans-unit.target: If you want an external, absolute URI to load within a [WebView](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/windows.ui.xaml.controls.webview.aspx) control that also exists in your app, call [WebView.Navigate](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/windows.ui.xaml.controls.webview.navigate.aspx) as part of your Click handler logic.

trans-unit.source: You don't typically handle the Click event as well as specifying a NavigateUri value, as these represent two different ways of using the hyperlink element.
trans-unit.target: You don't typically handle the Click event as well as specifying a NavigateUri value, as these represent two different ways of using the hyperlink element.

trans-unit.source: If your intent is to open the URI in the default browser, and you have specified a value for NavigateUri, don't handle the Click event.
trans-unit.target: If your intent is to open the URI in the default browser, and you have specified a value for NavigateUri, don't handle the Click event.

trans-unit.source: Conversely, if you handle the Click event, don't specify a NavigateUri.
trans-unit.target: Conversely, if you handle the Click event, don't specify a NavigateUri.

trans-unit.source: There's nothing you can do within the Click event handler to prevent the default browser from loading any valid target specified for NavigateUri; that action takes place automatically (asynchronously) when the hyperlink is activated and can't be canceled from within the Click event handler.
trans-unit.target: There's nothing you can do within the Click event handler to prevent the default browser from loading any valid target specified for NavigateUri; that action takes place automatically (asynchronously) when the hyperlink is activated and can't be canceled from within the Click event handler.

trans-unit.source: Hyperlink underlines
trans-unit.target: Hyperlink underlines

trans-unit.source: By default, hyperlinks are underlined.
trans-unit.target: By default, hyperlinks are underlined.

trans-unit.source: This underline is important because it helps meet accessibility requirements.
trans-unit.target: This underline is important because it helps meet accessibility requirements.

trans-unit.source: Color-blind users use the underline to distinguish between hyperlinks and other text.
trans-unit.target: Color-blind users use the underline to distinguish between hyperlinks and other text.

trans-unit.source: If you disable underlines, you should consider adding some other type of formatting difference to distinguish hyperlinks from other text, such as FontWeight or FontStyle.
trans-unit.target: If you disable underlines, you should consider adding some other type of formatting difference to distinguish hyperlinks from other text, such as FontWeight or FontStyle.

trans-unit.source: Hyperlink text elements
trans-unit.target: Hyperlink text elements

trans-unit.source: You can set the [UnderlineStyle](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/windows.ui.xaml.documents.hyperlink.underlinestyle.aspx) property to disable the underline.
trans-unit.target: You can set the [UnderlineStyle](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/windows.ui.xaml.documents.hyperlink.underlinestyle.aspx) property to disable the underline.

trans-unit.source: If you do, consider using [FontWeight](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/windows.ui.xaml.documents.textelement.fontweight.aspx) or [FontStyle](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/windows.ui.xaml.documents.textelement.fontstyle.aspx) to differentiate your link text.
trans-unit.target: If you do, consider using [FontWeight](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/windows.ui.xaml.documents.textelement.fontweight.aspx) or [FontStyle](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/windows.ui.xaml.documents.textelement.fontstyle.aspx) to differentiate your link text.

trans-unit.source: HyperlinkButton
trans-unit.target: HyperlinkButton

trans-unit.source: By default, the HyperlinkButton appears as underlined text when you set a string as the value for the [Content](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/windows.ui.xaml.controls.contentcontrol.content.aspx) property.
trans-unit.target: By default, the HyperlinkButton appears as underlined text when you set a string as the value for the [Content](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/windows.ui.xaml.controls.contentcontrol.content.aspx) property.

trans-unit.source: The text does not appear underlined in the following cases:
trans-unit.target: The text does not appear underlined in the following cases:

trans-unit.source: You set a [TextBlock](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/windows.ui.xaml.controls.textblock.aspx) as the value for the Content property, and set the [Text](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/windows.ui.xaml.controls.textblock.text.aspx) property on the TextBlock.
trans-unit.target: You set a [TextBlock](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/windows.ui.xaml.controls.textblock.aspx) as the value for the Content property, and set the [Text](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/windows.ui.xaml.controls.textblock.text.aspx) property on the TextBlock.

trans-unit.source: You re-template the HyperlinkButton and change the name of the [ContentPresenter](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/windows.ui.xaml.controls.contentpresenter.aspx) template part.
trans-unit.target: You re-template the HyperlinkButton and change the name of the [ContentPresenter](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/windows.ui.xaml.controls.contentpresenter.aspx) template part.

trans-unit.source: If you need a button that appears as non-underlined text, consider using a standard Button control and applying the built-in `TextBlockButtonStyle` system resource to its Style property.
trans-unit.target: If you need a button that appears as non-underlined text, consider using a standard Button control and applying the built-in `TextBlockButtonStyle` system resource to its Style property.

trans-unit.source: Notes for Hyperlink text element
trans-unit.target: Notes for Hyperlink text element

trans-unit.source: This section applies only to the Hyperlink text element, not to the HyperlinkButton control.
trans-unit.target: This section applies only to the Hyperlink text element, not to the HyperlinkButton control.

trans-unit.source: Input events
trans-unit.target: Input events

trans-unit.source: Because a Hyperlink is not a [UIElement](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/windows.ui.xaml.uielement.aspx), it does not have the set of UI element input events such as Tapped, PointerPressed, and so on.
trans-unit.target: Because a Hyperlink is not a [UIElement](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/windows.ui.xaml.uielement.aspx), it does not have the set of UI element input events such as Tapped, PointerPressed, and so on.

trans-unit.source: Instead, a Hyperlink has its own Click event, plus the implicit behavior of the system loading any URI specified as the NavigateUri.
trans-unit.target: Instead, a Hyperlink has its own Click event, plus the implicit behavior of the system loading any URI specified as the NavigateUri.

trans-unit.source: The system handles all input actions that should invoke the Hyperlink actions and raises the Click event in response.
trans-unit.target: The system handles all input actions that should invoke the Hyperlink actions and raises the Click event in response.

trans-unit.source: Content
trans-unit.target: Content

trans-unit.source: Hyperlink has restrictions on the content that can exist in its [Inlines](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/windows.ui.xaml.documents.span.inlines.aspx) collection.
trans-unit.target: Hyperlink has restrictions on the content that can exist in its [Inlines](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/windows.ui.xaml.documents.span.inlines.aspx) collection.

trans-unit.source: Specifically, a Hyperlink only permits [Run](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/windows.ui.xaml.documents.run.aspx) and other [Span]() types that aren't another Hyperlink.
trans-unit.target: Specifically, a Hyperlink only permits [Run](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/windows.ui.xaml.documents.run.aspx) and other [Span]() types that aren't another Hyperlink.

trans-unit.source: [InlineUIContainer](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/windows.ui.xaml.documents.inlineuicontainer.aspx) can't be in the Inlines collection of a Hyperlink.
trans-unit.target: [InlineUIContainer](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/windows.ui.xaml.documents.inlineuicontainer.aspx) can't be in the Inlines collection of a Hyperlink.

trans-unit.source: Attempting to add restricted content throws an invalid argument exception or XAML parse exception.
trans-unit.target: Attempting to add restricted content throws an invalid argument exception or XAML parse exception.

trans-unit.source: Hyperlink and theme/style behavior
trans-unit.target: Hyperlink and theme/style behavior

trans-unit.source: Hyperlink doesn't inherit from [Control](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/windows.ui.xaml.controls.control.aspx), so it doesn't have a [Style](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/windows.ui.xaml.frameworkelement.style.aspx) property or a [Template](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/windows.ui.xaml.controls.control.template.aspx).
trans-unit.target: Hyperlink doesn't inherit from [Control](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/windows.ui.xaml.controls.control.aspx), so it doesn't have a [Style](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/windows.ui.xaml.frameworkelement.style.aspx) property or a [Template](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/windows.ui.xaml.controls.control.template.aspx).

trans-unit.source: You can edit the properties that are inherited from [TextElement](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/windows.ui.xaml.documents.textelement.aspx), such as Foreground or FontFamily, to change the appearance of a Hyperlink, but you can't use a common style or template to apply changes.
trans-unit.target: You can edit the properties that are inherited from [TextElement](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/windows.ui.xaml.documents.textelement.aspx), such as Foreground or FontFamily, to change the appearance of a Hyperlink, but you can't use a common style or template to apply changes.

trans-unit.source: Instead of using a template, consider using common resources for values of Hyperlink properties to provide consistency.
trans-unit.target: Instead of using a template, consider using common resources for values of Hyperlink properties to provide consistency.

trans-unit.source: Some properties of Hyperlink use defaults from a {ThemeResource} markup extension value provided by the system.
trans-unit.target: Some properties of Hyperlink use defaults from a {ThemeResource} markup extension value provided by the system.

trans-unit.source: This enables the Hyperlink appearance to switch in appropriate ways when the user changes the system theme at run-time.
trans-unit.target: This enables the Hyperlink appearance to switch in appropriate ways when the user changes the system theme at run-time.

trans-unit.source: The default color of the hyperlink is the accent color of the system.
trans-unit.target: The default color of the hyperlink is the accent color of the system.

trans-unit.source: You can set the [Foreground](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/windows.ui.xaml.documents.textelement.foreground.aspx) property to override this.
trans-unit.target: You can set the [Foreground](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/windows.ui.xaml.documents.textelement.foreground.aspx) property to override this.

trans-unit.source: Recommendations
trans-unit.target: Recommendations

trans-unit.source: Only use hyperlinks for navigation; don't use them for other actions.
trans-unit.target: Only use hyperlinks for navigation; don't use them for other actions.

trans-unit.source: Use the Body style from the type ramp for text-based hyperlinks.
trans-unit.target: Use the Body style from the type ramp for text-based hyperlinks.

trans-unit.source: Read about [**fonts and the Windows 10 type ramp**](text-controls.md).
trans-unit.target: Read about [**fonts and the Windows 10 type ramp**](text-controls.md).

trans-unit.source: Keep discrete hyperlinks far enough apart so that the user can differentiate between them and has an easy time selecting each one.
trans-unit.target: Keep discrete hyperlinks far enough apart so that the user can differentiate between them and has an easy time selecting each one.

trans-unit.source: Add tooltips to hyperlinks that indicate to where the user will be directed.
trans-unit.target: Add tooltips to hyperlinks that indicate to where the user will be directed.

trans-unit.source: If the user will be directed to an external site, include the top-level domain name inside the tooltip, and style the text with a secondary font color.
trans-unit.target: If the user will be directed to an external site, include the top-level domain name inside the tooltip, and style the text with a secondary font color.

trans-unit.source: This article contains information that is specific to Universal Windows Platform (UWP) apps and Windows 10.
trans-unit.target: This article contains information that is specific to Universal Windows Platform (UWP) apps and Windows 10.

trans-unit.source: For Windows 8.1 guidance, please download the [Windows 8.1 guidelines PDF](https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?linkid=258743).
trans-unit.target: For Windows 8.1 guidance, please download the [Windows 8.1 guidelines PDF](https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?linkid=258743).
